title: Extension
description: Extension can be added to a section of a SectionedTable. It allows custom extension to be rendered in that section.

Height.description: Height of the extension (pt in iOS / dp in Android)

IsScrollable.description: If the height of the extension area cannot display the full content, you can use this property in the Section Extension control to enable nested scrolling within the extension view. This is Android only.

Target.description: Binding target for this extension. The result of this binding will be stored in the form of an Observable array and it can be accessed in the extension class via `context.binding` property of the base class, e.g. `this.context.binding`.

Footer.description: Footer bar to be displayed below this control's content section.

Header.description: Header bar to be displayed above this control's content section.

Separators.description: To provide more flexibility with rendering of controls and sections, set the visibility of the separator lines.

EmptySection.description: A section that will be displayed when the list is empty, this only applies if you are using Target binding. Allows you to show custom label when the list is empty.

DataSubscriptions.description: Array of data change events to subscribe to.

Module.description: The module's folder path under `/extensions/`, e.g. `MyExtModule` or `MyExtLibrary/MyExtModule`. Not required if Extension does not implement TS code under `/extensions/controls`.

Control.description: The name of the file under the `controls` folder in your module. e.g. MyExtension, if your file name is `/extensions/controls/MyExtension.ts`. If not specified, module name would be used as the value for this property.

Class.description: The name of the exported class in the module control that is to be used for the extension.

ExtensionProperties.description: Additional custom properties to be passed to the extension

OnPress.description: Action/Rule to be triggered when the extension is pressed
